Text: Thank you
Btw, in the beginning of the game, you are supposed to get killed by first two monsters you encounter (in the dark alley), so turn off invulnerability for that part.
I figure I'll play this. I've listened to the Silent Hill OST collection many times over now. I guess I could actually -play- the games for once.

@ DiMarko

As long as you dont mind the graphics in this one. Silent Hill 2, 3 and 4 look ten times better. But most people believe 1-st is the best game in the series.

@illiria

can you please  make silent hill origins or shattered memories into like this i mean if i explain my self well by putting the emulator and game together like this in other words this game was homemade imported to pc but this uses a psx emulator instead of a pc game engine  your a cool uploader your uploads are unique

@ gunnersrock 

I can upload the rest, sure. I haven't worked on them though. Would be just a simple game-crack-trainer (not mine). you can already find that all around. Wouldn't be a "unique" release, but I can upload that to gather all silent stuff in one place.


My next releases... Definitely Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic games. I've put TONS of work into them. Created very good custom patches for both games that fix dozens of bugs, and include a complere high-resilution remaster of both games.

Next is gonna be Resident Evil 1-3, I think. Repacks there are not made by me (but by someone very talented, great repacks), but I wrote the trainers for these releases. So it will be the ONLY Residents 1-3 that actually have cheats (uploading trainers alone will likely be no good, coz I wrote them for these specific versions).

After that... We'll see. I guess I should release my small (but very unique) trainer collection already. You just can't find the trainers for eomulated Silent Hill, or emulated Mortal Kombat Trilogy, working trainers for Resident 1-3, or Gun Metal, or Rebel Assault, or... etc.

@ elturbo9077

I can do that, but it won't be soon. Because I normally don't work with emulators, I have no real experience in configuring them properly. So I can do that - eventually - but it will take quite some time to put everything properly into a single release and thoroughly test it.

Due to the specific nature of modern games, operating system differences and game software requirements, not everyone can get even my PC releases working flawlessly, let alone emulators...

@illiria 

thanks alot man take your time i will be waiting for that big day and real silent hill fans will be happy also psp version of orgins is better than the ps2 version becuase it has better graphics and can emulate it  better i ask to much right do resident evil code veronica and zero also if possible just take your time

@ elturbo9077 

I want to do Code Veronica also. Chances are, I will get to it some time soon. Already looking into it.

@ elturbo9077

I'm not really that interested in RE1 remake. I have original game, it works flawlessly under xp/vista/7 (some guy did a GREAT repack), and I've passed RE1 seven times, and ABSOLUTELY love it. I don't want any other. :) RE1, original, is my most favorite.

I'll check the remake though.
I don't care about graphics while playing games, half the time. I still would rather play Megaman Legends 1&2 than some of the 'Adventure' games out these days.

Does the trainer work for you people? This whole torrent is primarily a test for the trainer. :) Just figured I'd throw in a game with it, since I made a repack.
Should work for everyone, since I tested it on multiple computers and every system, but I am curious to get a user feedback. Just remember, UAC in Vista/7 can get in the way of hotkeys.
I can verify that the trainer works perfectly, very nice job with this illiria, I would love to see the end result of Code Veronica when your finished, Cheers.

@ Cerebral222

Happy to hear the trainer works great. That means I can write trainers for other emulated games, and as you know, some of them are just too hard to play on PC.
